statements.name: PROC SMSPEC
statements.help:
PROC SMSPEC  ;                 
	ARIMA  NAME=libref.data-table<options>;                 
	INPUT variable-list </ options>;                 
	REG  NAME=libref.data-table<options>;                 
	TARGET  TRANSFORM=NONE | LOG | LOGM;

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: generates a data table, named data-table, in the specified {library} to contain the model specification

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level for computing confidence limits for historical fit and holdout forecast

arguments.name: HOLDOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the length of holdout---that is, the number of observations at the end of a training data set to be used for holdout analysis as a part of the model calibration process

arguments.name: P=
arguments.description: specifies the range of values of autoregressive (AR) orders for ARIMA specification, where Pmin is an integer greater than or equal to 0 and Pmax is an integer greater than or equal to Pmin

arguments.name: Q=
arguments.description: specifies the range of values of moving average (MA) orders for ARIMA specification, where Qmin is an integer greater than or equal to 0 and Qmax is an integer greater than or equal to Qmin

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: specifies the list of explanatory variables for the model

arguments.name: REQUIRED=
arguments.description: specifies whether all the variables in the variable-list are required

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: specifies the transformation type for all variables in the variable-list

statements.name: REG
statements.description: requests an OLS regression model specification

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: generates a data table, named data-table, in the specified {library} to contain the model specification

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level for computing confidence limits for historical fit and holdout forecast

arguments.name: HOLDOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the length of holdout---that is, the number of observations at the end of a training data set to be used for holdout analysis as a part of the model calibration process

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: specifies the transformation type for the target variable in the model

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: specifies the transformation type: {Deflist} [LOG] specifies a natural log transformation: X
